fields.description:
Currently there is no method to navigate to a full page view of an issue from Rapid Board.  Clicking on any issue only allows it to show on the right of the browser.  The current around is to right-click an issue and open it in a new tab/window.

There should be an "View Issue" button (maybe next to the 'Hide Details') to allow for a full issue view.
fields.summary: There's no apparent way to get to the "full screen view" of an issue from the details on the Rapid Board

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Hi Team,

There are numerous number of cases which Greenhopper functionality is broken due to customer is using *Custom Project Key Pattern* in JIRA. I have talked with Dev about this and mentioned that we don't support a Custom Project Key Pattern. I'm also aware we have put a warning in the documentation for [changing project key pattern|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Configuring+Project+Keys] in JIRA.

It would be best if Greenhopper would report to the user that the problem is that their project key does not work with Greenhopper and that they should change it. A simple warning/error message in the logs should prevent our customer to get confuse to find out what might be gone wrong with their GH features. 

Cheers,

Vicky
fields.summary: Greenhopper must have an error message if the user is using Custom Project Key Pattern.

fields.description:
Use of Resolve issue Permission to scheduling issues has been broken in GreenHopper.

*Test 1*
# Create a new user call user1
# Associate user1 with "Schedule Issues" permission
# Make sure the "Scheduling Permission" check box is *unchecked* via _Agile>Tools>Configuration>General Configuration
# In the planning board, try to drag a card to other version.
|

Result: User1 not able to drag card. (/)
|

*Test 2*
* Same as Test 1 but with "Scheduling Permission" check box *Checked*
|

Result: User1 able to drag card to other version. (/)
|

*Test 3* 
# Remove "Schedule Issues" permission from User1
# Associate him with "Resolve Issues" permission.
# Make sure the "Scheduling Permission" check box is *unchecked* via _Agile>Tools>Configuration>General Configuration
# In the planning board, try to drag a card to other version.
|

Result: User1 able to drag card but failed with error "Insufficient privileges!" when move to other version (x)
|

*Test 4*
* Same as test 3 but with "Scheduling Permission" check box *Checked*
|

Result: User1 not able to drag card. (/)

Workaround:
Enable "Scheduling Permission" and give user "Schedule Issues" permission
fields.summary: Use of Resolve issue Permission to scheduling issues has been broken in GreenHopper

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Currently in JIRA to to see the *remaining* (not total) story points in an epic, you must create a custom filter, you can not simply pull down a chart to do it.

Having this kind of roll up is very valuable to teams working epics.

What doesn't work:

1) Crete a new context based on Epic issue type: http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH/Using+Contexts+to+Filter+and+Highlight+Issues, this doesn't help because it just shows the total points, it doesn't show the time remaining on a  per epic issue.

2) use the task board: http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH/Working+with+Epics, that doesn't help either because again, it does not show the time remaining per epic.

We need a way to see a chart that shows the time remaining per epic, not per version.

The awkward work around; if you use a burndown chart with a custom filter for a specific epic name, then yes you can see the time remaining for that epic, but only for that epic...if your project hs several epics having to manually create this filter all the time (as new epics are created) is not practical.

We need a way to see a chart that shows the time remaining per epic.
fields.summary: as a user I need to see the *remaining* story points in an epic

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: Currently the GreenHopper Agile Gadget will only show unreleased versions. We would like it so released versions can also be selected. The goal is to be able to use the GreenHopper Agile Gadget and embed it on a Confluence page in order to show a projects history.
fields.summary: Provide option to display released versions with the GreenHopper Agile Gadget

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Hello Guys,

While this problem is very easy to reproduce, is also very weird.

So, steps are:
- going in Rapid Board
- selecting one issue
- clicking on "Edit" button.

The strange part is: If just accessing the edit screen by clicking the button, you're always taken to the edit screen inside JIRA. However, if you, instead of clicking the button, press "e" on the keyboard to enter the edit screen, you are taken correctly in the edit screen inside greenhopper. Strangest thing is, after pressing "e" for the first time, any other action (clicking the button, or pressing "e" again), takes you correctly to the edit issue screen inside Greenhopper.

Cheers.

Thiago Prisco
fields.summary: Edit Issue Screen, when accessed from the rapid board, is the edit issue screen from JIRA, when clicking on the "Edit" button for the first time.

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
If a user Edits an issue and removes a parent fix version from an issue and not one of the sub-versions, then the Greenhopper Fix Version Synchronizer will by design undo the removal of the parent fix version before updating the issue.

It would be great if some message were conveyed to the user after the update as to what happened or perhaps conveyed to the user right when they remove the parent version.

Right now many of our users cannot figure out why they can't remove the parent version without removing the sub-version and they do it repeatedly and then report it to the Jira admins as a bug.
fields.summary: Give users a message when they attempt to remove a parent fix version without removing a sub-version of that parent version

Disable GreenHopper and everything goes fine.
fields.summary: "Multiple heads found in rank chain" error occurs when user try to migrate Issue Type Scheme, clone issue, delete and move issue.

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
On the following screens of GH
Task Board
Planning Board
Released Board
Chart Board
Clicking on 'Create Issue' link results in Error Dialog.
Error dialog says 
""status-code":500,"message":"Can not deserialize instance of java.util.ArrayList out of VALUE_STRING token\n at [Source: org.apache.catalina.connector.CoyoteInputStream@b5b58a; line: 1, column: 21]"}"
fields.summary: Clicking on 'Create Issue' from GH screens results in 500 Error.

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: When the customer clicks on the Agile > Planning Board he wants to be redirect directly to the "Project Overview" screen.
fields.summary: Ability to set a default screen when click on Agile > Planning Board

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
In order for rapid board reports to be meaningful, you need to include a column representing the "end" state ("resolved" for example). However, this column is filling up very quickly, which makes the Rapid Board Work view difficult to use when you have more than one swimlane.
Therefore, it should be possible to hide the last column, while maintaining it for reports.
fields.summary: As a Rapid Board user, I would like to hide a column from the board while keeping it for reports

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Software Server*. Using *JIRA Software Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWCLOUD-3928].
  {panel}

Develop Tokes' spike to add configurable permissions from plugins 
- Specifically refers to global permissions 
- Needs additional development to work for project permissions 

COS: 
- Code from Spike needs to be reviewed by Spud and Mark Lassau
- Needs to be merged to Jira (either by the Jira team or us) 
- Work needs to go in 5.0 branch for GH
- Define new permission in plugin file and convert our code to use the new permission 
- Build some Jira automated tests for use by the Jira CI
fields.summary: As a GH administrator, I would like the ability to define which groups have the ability to rank issues across project

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
The assignee cannot be changed back to unassigned once it has been assigned to a user on the taskboard (e.g. Unassigned -> Jim -> Unassigned throws an error). However, if the project's default assignee is set to unassigned then no error is thrown (e.g. Unassigned -> Jim -> Auto-Assign -> Unassigned)

The behavior works as expected when you assign the issue in JIRA.
fields.summary: Unassigned not accepted as a valid assignee

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Change 'Only My Issues', 'Hide Done Issues', 'Hide Sub-tasks' looks when clicked instead of just changing color. The color changed can be subtle to be noticed.

The texts should change e.g. 'Hide Done Issues' changed to 'Show Done Issues' after clicked.
fields.summary: Change 'Only My Issues', 'Hide Done Issues', 'Hide Sub-tasks' looks when clicked

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
It would be very nice to be able to navigate from an issue on the rapid board to it's detailed (Default) Jira view screen - just like you can do from a card in the Planning and Task Boards.
This should be accessible from both the card itself and from the built-in RapidBoard Detail view.
fields.summary: As a user, I would like to be able to go to the detailed issue view from the RapidBoard

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
It would be nice to be able to modify the fields that are displayed in the cards on the RapidBoard, just like you can for the Planing and Task boards.
In particular, it would be nice to be able to show the name of the assignee in addition of their avatar :)

*Please Note* 

This issue relates to configuring the layout of the card on the Rapid Board. If you are instead interested in configuring the fields shown in the detail view that pops up when you click on an issue in the Rapid Board, please see [GHS-3474 - As a Rapid Board user I would like to configure the detail view for an issue|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/GHS-3474]


!download.png!



----
Latest update by Tom can be found at [here|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/GHS-3922?focusedCommentId=503166&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-503166]
fields.summary: As a user, I would like to configure the cards displayed in the rapid board

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
We generally archive our sprints (versions) when they are over, which I assume is common practice to keep the version list short.
However, when I want to see statistics and compare velocity etc by using the Chart Board, archived versions do not display, which is frustrating because I want to see how we are doing compared to last release etc.

For example 

Chart Board | <parent version> | Story Points | By Children
(also happens with the similar Release Board chart)

This shows a bar for each child version (sprint) and the story points completed and is great for seeing if our velocity is improving, but if a child version (sprint) is archived it will not show on the chart.
fields.summary: Chart board does not support archived versions

fields.description:
In GH you can enable a night service AND version/component sync'ing.

It seems that this sync'ing still takes affect when GH is disabled or expired. This is a PITA because I don't want my versions to keep getting changed on me and I have no way of turning it off since the GH config has disappeared.

This is critical for studio and needs to be fixed before their next release. The work need to be done one the closed branch ondemand-fixes

Original bug is at https://sdog.jira.com/browse/JSTDEV-903

fields.description:
Use case:
We have a browser session open with a tab for each project context, this is saved as a browser session. When reopened the project context defaults to the last project context selected, in this case one is left with a bunch of open tabs for the same assignee. If one uses a tab reloader when each tab is activated then the project context just keeps bouncing to the last selected on a tab.

Can the web service be updated to include an project context reference in the URL to avoids this happening?

I made a similar request to have the assignee added to the url GHS-3293
fields.summary: Task board - add the project context to the url

fields.description:
When a customer is given the option to upgrade GreenHopper via the UPM  (replacing GreenHopper under System Plugins) the Agile Tab disapears and can also cause licensing errors. 

Comment from customer expereicing issue:
I can no longer see the 'agile' menu item within the navigation of jira after having upgraded to the latest versions for both jira and greenhopper. I have tried to search within the administration to be able to customize the menu, but I did not find such configuration. An agile tab is accessible after clicking on a project, which is fine, although it takes one more click now, but the thing is, if I enable the RapidBoard under the greenhopper labs in the configuration, I cannot seem to see "Rapid Board" since I think it only adds the option within the main menu, which I cannot see!

*Recommended Workaround*
To implement the workaround please follow the instructions below:
1. Under Administration > Plugins > Plugins > Confirm that the GreenHopper Plugin is listed under User-Installed Plugins (See screenshot_one)
- If the plugin is indeed listed here then proceed to Step 2. 
2. Uninstall GreenHopper if located under User-installed Plugins
3. Shut Down JIRA
3. Remove the following folders from your {{<jira-home>/plugins}} folder (these folders may be hidden and an ls -al may be necessary):
** {{.bundled-plugins}}
** {{.osgi-plugins}}
4. Remove the following plugin jar -plugin_16826164119203945_jira-greenhopper-plugin-5.8.jar-  from your {{<jira-home>/plugins/installed-plugins}} folder (note that the plugin may have already been removed)
5. Restart JIRA
6. Under Administration > Plugins > Plugins > Show System Plugins > GreenHopper > Enable (See screenshot_two)

The Agile Tab will now be visible. Please *hold off* on upgrading JIRA via the UPM before we have found the root cause of this issue.
fields.summary: Agile menu has disappeared after jira and greenhopper upgrade.

fields.description:
The agile burndown chart uses the issue's *Remaining hours* field even if the issue is closed. This makes little sense--if the issue is closed, then by definition it has 0 remaining time.

This is a big annoyance: the chart becomes wildly inaccurate if we consistently use less time than estimated to satisfy issues.

Because of this, I have to either log work myself (as the admin) or force my devs to mark remaining time as 0. This usually means a separate use of the *Log work* dialog, which requires us to log work every time we adjust the issue's remaining time. This makes a mess of time reporting and is a pointless step since, again, a closed issue has no remaining work. Otherwise, it shouldn't be closed.

Further, what if we need to reopen the issue? It would be nice to keep burning against its remaining time instead of having to totally re-estimate because we had to manually force it to 0 time before closing it.

Expected behavior: If I close an issue, the agile burndown chart should consider the issue as having 0 remaining time regardless of the value of its *Remaining hours* field.
fields.summary: Agile burndown chart shows closed issues as having remaining time

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
We want to have the Dev in Progress and Dev review columns to have a shared limit, along with other columns. 

This seems to be pretty common in most Kanban systems i've seen. Would love this ability in the Rapid Board.
fields.summary: As a RB PM/user I'd like the ability to set multiple consecutive columns to share limits
